channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Fresh Air' goes out to the ballgame
item.description: After a memorable All-Star game, today we listen back to some favorite baseball interviews from the Fresh Air archives: conversations with Jamie Moyer...

item.title: Here are some of the newest UNESCO World Heritage sites
item.description: Bavarian palaces, imperial tombs in China and memorials to Khmer Rouge victims are among the sites being recognized by the United Nations agency.

item.title: 10 Americans are freed from Venezuela in a prisoner swap for migrants in El Salvador
item.description: Venezuela has freed 10 Americans in exchange for Venezuelans whom the United States had sent to a prison in El Salvador.

item.title: The Downstream Effects of China's Rare Earth Mining
item.description: China has nearly cornered the market in rare earth minerals, which are a necessary component to much of our technology today. But China sources some o...

item.title: New U.S. Postal Service head says he doesn't believe in privatizing the mail agency
item.description: Postmaster General David Steiner told USPS workers he doesn't believe in privatizing the agency. President Trump has expressed support for such a move...

item.title: Three killed in explosion at Los Angeles police training facility
item.description: Federal agents are investigating, but authorities describe it as "an isolated incident" with no further threat to the public.

item.title: 7/15: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump threatens tariffs targeting Russia if there's no Ukraine peace deal in 50 days; Unreleased Beyonce music stolen from vehicle in Atlant...

item.title: Colombian gold miners rescued after about 18 hours trapped underground
item.description: Eighteen miners are in good health after a 12-hour-long rescue operation, Colombia's National Mining Agency says.

item.title: Romance scam victim travels 700km 'to marry French beauty queen'
item.description: The Belgian turned up at the home of Sophie Vouzelaud in France only to realise he had been a victim of fraud.

item.title: Court orders Bolsonaro to wear ankle tag and puts him under curfew
item.description: A court in Brazil also bars the ex-president from using social media and put him under 24-hour surveillance.

item.title: El Salvador and US negotiate prisoner swap with Venezuela
item.description: Some 250 Venezuelans deported from the US to El Salvador were exchanged for 10 Americans held by Caracas.

item.title: Coldplay’s jumbotron captures — what exactly? The internet has its theories
Astronomer board investigating CEO after Coldplay kiss-cam video
item.description: Tech company Astronomer said its board has launched an investigation after CEO Andy Byron was seen embracing a coworker at a Coldplay concert.

item.title: CBS News poll: Most Americans favor U.S. returning to moon, going to Mars
item.description: Many think the space program adds to feelings of national pride and patriotism, a CBS News poll shows.

item.title: Blast at training facility kills 3 Los Angeles deputies in one of department’s worst losses of life
item.description: An explosion at a Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department training facility killed three veteran deputies from the arson and explosives unit.

item.title: 7/11: CBS Morning News
item.description: ICE raids at California cannabis farms turn violent; Fired Justice Department official warns of retribution inside agency.

item.title: 17-year-old charged with murder in paddleboarder’s killing at a pond in rural Maine
10 Americans freed in prisoner swap between U.S., El Salvador, Venezuela
item.description: Ten Americans are en route to the U.S. after a prisoner swap involving the U.S., El Salvador and Venezuela, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Friday...
